tutorial.title: Coffee shop menu - Part 2
tutorial.descriptionContent: With our menu structure in place, let's bring it to life! This phase is all about making our coffee shop menu visually stunning and user-friendly.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome back! In the first part, we created the first version of a local coffee shop's menu and added some initial style rules. But we can still do better! We'll start by styling the menu items.

1. In `index.html`, set a `menu-item` class to each list item.
2. Switch to the `style.css` file, and add an empty rule that targets the `menu-item` class.
3. Set its display to `block`, to get rid of the characteristic unordered list bullets.
4. Adjust the font size to `18px`.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, we'll want to set a font for both the text in the pastel orange header and the unordered list items.

1. In `style.css`, create an empty rule for the `body`.
2. Inside the rule, set the text font to `"Helvetica", sans-serif`.

executableContent.instructions:
We want our menu to have a more vital visual communication, so let's add a coffee picture. We'll later position it parallel to the menu list.

1. In `index.html`, under the `div`, add an image using the following URL: 
   ```"https://mimo.app/i/gray-coffee-maker.png"```
2. Create a second `div` element and nest the image and the unordered list inside it, to show that they belong together.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Right now, the image is too large and placed randomly on the webpage. Let's take care of that: we'll start by reducing the image dimensions.

1. In the `index.html` file, set the class `coffee-image` to the image element.
2. Switch to `style.css` and create an empty rule that targets the `coffee-image` class.
3. Inside the rule, set the right margin to `20px`, and the top margin to `15px`.
4. Finally, set the width to `100px`.

lessons.title: Display the image on the menu

executableContent.instructions:
One last step: place the image visually at the same level as the menu items but to the right. 

1. Inside the same rule as before, set the image's `position` to `relative` to enable using `z-index`.
2. Set the `z-index` value to `2`, to make sure that the image will show on top of the menu and not behind it.
3. Finally, make the image float to the right of the menu.
